question: Can I afford a mortgage of $300,000 with an annual income of $80,000 and a credit score of 700?
true_answer: Yes, with a credit score of 700 and DTI of 28%, you can afford the mortgage. Down payment 5-20%.

steps.content: Can I afford a mortgage of $300,000 with an annual income of $80,000 and a credit score of 700?
Plan: 1) Consult home_loan_agent for affordability criteria. 2) Collaborate with credit_agent for credit analysis. 3) Use calculator for DTI. 4) Have supervisor review. 5) Deliver final answer.
Retrieving knowledge on mortgage affordability criteria.
Typical affordability requires credit score over 620 and debt-to-income ratio under 36%.
Checking credit score: 700 is well above 620, excellent status.
Calculating debt-to-income ratio based on provided income.
Calculated DTI is 28%, which is within acceptable range.
How much should I prepare for a down payment?
Fetching details on down payment requirements.
Down payment usually ranges from 5% to 20% based on the loan program.
Yes, with a credit score of 700 and DTI of 28%, you can afford the mortgage. Down payment 5-20%.
